articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Shrinking giants: North Atlantic right whales getting tinier
articles.description: One of the giants of the deep is shrinking before our eyes, a new study says. The younger generation of critically endangered North Atlantic right whales are on average about three feet shorter than whales were 20 years ago, drone and aircraft data show in a …

articles.title: Canada now among top countries for 1st doses of COVID-19 vaccines. So how high can we go?
articles.description: After lagging behind other countries in the early months of vaccination, Canada is now among the leaders when it comes to the percentage of the population vaccinated against COVID-19 with at least one dose. But the next steps could get harder.

articles.title: How Canada can crush the variants with vaccines and make this reopening our last
articles.description: Canada is poised to battle back more contagious coronavirus variants that threaten to jeopardize reopening plans across the country due to a huge uptick in vaccine supply, a willingness from Canadians to get the shots and some promising new vaccine research.
